page.title: 20RELIGION IN SKERRIES
page.content: Skerries has one small{Church of {Scotland}and services take place twice every Sunday one at 11:45 and one at 5:45.{Sunday School}is at 12:00 and five women who live on Skerries take turns in teaching the children who are aged between 3 and 12. There are three{elders}and one retired elder. The Rev.James Dey takes the services normally but the{minister from Whalsay, a neighbouring island visits to take weddings, Commmunions, Christenings. etc. Once a year we have a{Hunger Lunch where people give to a Third World Charity what they would spend on their Sunday lunch and eat only soup and bread instead. Another annual event is the{Sunday School Picnic.}Nearly every able person is present. A variety of races and games take place and refreshments are served.
